Description: Pottery jar with flat base, globular body and high neck, made of Nile silt with many organic inclusions and coated with a smoky black slip and burnished vertically in a streaky manner. The top of the neck has been ground down and smoothed.
Curator's comments: Brunton’s All black, AB9. The fabric and the manufacturing technique suggest that this vessel is an import from Lower Egypt.
Bibliographic references: Brunton & Caton-Thompson 1928 / The Badarian Civilisation and Predynastic Remains near Badari (6, 22; pl. xvi.AB9; xx.11)
Condition: fair; slip is worn from neck area
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
